alert.note: Alert for Northwest Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 30 at 6:56AM EST until January 30 at 12:00PM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON EST TODAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills. Blowing snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch. Wind chills as low as 20 below zero. * WHERE...Northwest Aroostook County. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until noon EST today. For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 10 AM EST this morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility and cause localized hazardous travel. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: A Winter Weather Advisory for blowing snow means blowing snow will cause primarily travel difficulties. Expect snow covered roads and limited visibilities, and use caution while driving. A Wind Chill Advisory means that cold air and the wind will combine to create low wind chills. Frostbite and hypothermia can occur if precautions are not taken. Make sure you wear a hat and gloves. The latest road conditions for Maine can be obtained by going to newengland511.org.
